Exercise

Which of the following are true?

generalfeedback.text:
Let \(z = r(\cos \theta + i\sin \theta)\). Then \(|z| = r \implies |z|^2 = r^2\). Also we have \(z^2 = r^2 (\cos \theta + i\sin \theta)^2\) which implies that \(|z^2| = r^2\). Therefore \( |z^2| = |z|^2 \).


Let \(z = a + ib\). Then \(zz^* = (a+ib)(a-ib) = a^2 + b^2\). Note that \(|z| = \sqrt{a^2 + b^2}\) which implies that \(|z|^2 = a^2+b^2\). Therefore \( z z^* = |z|^2 \).
